attributes.action: Allow Ketmanee, Tananya and Suchada to have a holiday in Felixstowe
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tananya and Ketmanee are poor Thai nationals personally sponsored by James Walsh. Please allow them and their guardian Suchada to have a holiday in Felixstowe. 
The British government has unreasonably declined to issue them visas on the grounds that as they are poor they would not return to their own country. This demonstrates arrogance, pompousness and  blatant prejudice.
The fact is that due to the sponsorship, which includes provision to ensure the children will be educated until they complete university, they have a better lifestyle and far better prospects in their own country than they could expect in Britain.
It is accepted that having immigration controls is necessary but in this case their application is to the detriment of Britain and contradicts statements by the government regarding world poverty. 
Please issue visas. It is the only sensible option.
Case Numbers Bangkok\380521, 2 and 3 refer. 

Quote by Gordon Brown:-

I believe in the power of opportunity to change lives.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
